com.apriori.testing

Class ObjectVerifiers

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • com.apriori.testing.ObjectVerifiers

  • public final class ObjectVerifiers
extends junit.framework.Assert
    Utility methods and constants for using and creating ObjectVerifier instances.

    • Field Summary

      static ObjectVerifier<java.lang.Object> NO_OP
      An object verifier that doesn't actually do any verification but just returns the test object.

      An object that verifies that the test object is null if the reference object is null and non-null otherwise.

      An object that verifies that the test object is the same instance as the reference object (via the == operator).
      static ObjectVerifier<java.lang.Throwable> STRICT_EXCEPTIONS
      An object that verifies that the test exception has the same class as that of the reference exception.

    • Field Detail

      • NO_OP

        public static final ObjectVerifier<java.lang.Object> NO_OP
        An object verifier that doesn't actually do any verification but just returns the test object.

      • NULLS

        public static final ObjectVerifier<java.lang.Object> NULLS
        An object that verifies that the test object is null if the reference object is null and non-null otherwise.

      • EQUALS

        public static final ObjectVerifier<java.lang.Object> EQUALS
        An object that verifies that the test object is equal to the reference object via Object.equals(). If the reference object is an array then this will verify that their contents are equal using Arrays.deepEquals(Object[], Object[]). If the reference object is an array but the test object is not, the verification will fail.

      • HASH_CODES

        public static final ObjectVerifier<java.lang.Object> HASH_CODES
        An object that verifies that the test object is equal to the reference object by checking that their hash codes are the same. If one of the objects is null and the other is non-null, verification will fail.

      • SAME

        public static final ObjectVerifier<java.lang.Object> SAME
        An object that verifies that the test object is the same instance as the reference object (via the == operator).

      • STRICT_EXCEPTIONS

        public static final ObjectVerifier<java.lang.Throwable> STRICT_EXCEPTIONS
        An object that verifies that the test exception has the same class as that of the reference exception. If one of the objects is null and the other is non-null, verification will fail.

    • Method Detail

      • relaxedExceptions

        public static ObjectVerifier<java.lang.Throwable> relaxedExceptions(java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Throwable>> exceptions)
        Returns an object that verifies that the test exception is compatible with the reference exception.

        The test exception is compatible if any of the following are true:

        • The test exception's class is the same as that of the reference exception
        • The test exception's class is a sub-class of that of the reference exception
        • Both the test exception and reference exception are sub-classes of one of the specified exception classes

        If one of the objects is null and the other is non-null, verification will fail.

        Parameters:
        exceptions - the set of exception super-classes
        Returns:
        the object verifier
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified set or any class therein is null

      • relaxedExceptions

        @SafeVarargs
public static ObjectVerifier<java.lang.Throwable> relaxedExceptions(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Throwable>... exceptions)
        Returns an object that verifies that the test exception is compatible with the reference exception.
        Parameters:
        exceptions - the set of allowed exception types
        Returns:
        the object verifier
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any class specified is null
        See Also:
        relaxedExceptions(Set)

      • checkInstance

        public static <T> ObjectVerifier<T> checkInstance(T instance)
        Returns an object that verifies that the test object is the same as a specified instance.

        This verifier is useful for testing method chaining with mutable objects. In such cases, it is expected that the method will return the instance under test itself.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the instance and the verifier
        Parameters:
        instance - The objected expected as the test value
        Returns:
        A verifier that verifies that the test value is the same object as instance

      • forComparable

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> ObjectVerifier<T> forComparable()
        Returns an object that verifies that the test object matches the reference object by checking that Comparable.compareTo(Object) is zero. If one of the objects is null and the other is non-null, verification will fail.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object being verified
        Returns:
        the object verifier

      • fromComparator

        public static <T> ObjectVerifier<T> fromComparator(java.util.Comparator<T> c)
        Returns an object that verifies that the test object matches the reference object by using the specified Comparator. The object will verify that Comparator.compare(Object, Object) returns zero when comparing the test and reference objects. If one of the objects is null and the other is non-null, verification will fail.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object being verified
        Parameters:
        c - the comparator that performs the comparison
        Returns:
        the object verifier
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified comparator is null

      • compositeVerifier

        public static <T> ObjectVerifier<T> compositeVerifier(java.util.List<ObjectVerifier<T>> verifiers)
        Returns an object that performs all specified verifications. This verifier will return the value returned by the last verifier provided.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object being verified
        Parameters:
        verifiers - the sequence of verifiers to use
        Returns:
        the object verifier
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the specified verifiers is null

      • compositeVerifier

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> ObjectVerifier<T> compositeVerifier(ObjectVerifier<T>... verifiers)
        Returns an object that performs all specified verifications. This verifier will return the value returned by the last verifier provided.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object being verified
        Parameters:
        verifiers - the sequence of verifiers to use
        Returns:
        the object verifier
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the specified verifiers is null

      • forTesting

        public static <T> ObjectVerifier<T> forTesting(java.lang.Class<T> iface)
        Returns a special object verifier that returns a testing proxy.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the interface implemented by the proxy
        Parameters:
        iface - a class token for the interface
        Returns:
        a testing proxy
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified class token does not represent an interface
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified class token is null
        See Also:
        forTesting(Class, ClassLoader)

      • forTesting

        public static <T> ObjectVerifier<T> forTesting(java.lang.Class<T> iface,
                                               java.lang.ClassLoader classLoader)
        Returns a special object verifier that returns a testing proxy. The returned proxy subsequently verifies that the test object implements its methods in the same way as the reference object. Callers can use InterfaceVerifier.verifierFor(Object) to configure how the test object's implementation should be tested. If one of the objects is null and the other is non-null, verification will fail.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the interface implemented by the proxy
        Parameters:
        iface - a class token for the interface
        classLoader - the class loader used to define the proxy class
        Returns:
        a testing proxy
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified class token does not represent an interface or if the interface is not visible from the specified class loader
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified interface is null
